data.title: hashihime 橋姫
data.text:
Seiyuu Award Winners for 2012 Announced

Here are the main winners from the seventh annual Seiyuu Awards ceremony, which was held Saturday evening in Tokyo:

Leading man: Leading lady:

Kaji Yuuki Asumi Kana

Supporting men:

Ono Yuuki Suwabe Junichi

Supporting women:

Oohara Sayaka Tomatsu Haruka

Newcomer men:

Shimazaki Nobunaga Yamamoto Kazutomi

Newcomer women:

Ishihara Kaori Ookubo Rumi

I'm fairly happy with the selections. Asumi Kana and Kaji Yuuki are both good seiyuus. Oohara Sayaka is one of the best, and Tomacchan getting better and better.

Suwabe Junichi is one of my absolute favorite male seiyuus.

Ishihara Kaori is one of my favorite female seiyuus, and Ookubo Rumi, while not at the top of the craft, did very well in YuruYuri and Acchi Kocchi. I like her more for herself than for her performances, but that's okay.

I must admit, however, that Carrie (Ishihara Kaori) is the only one of these whom I voted for myself.

Full results on Anime News Network. Kamiya Hiroshi won the award for most votes for all awards. The singing award went to Asumi Kana, Matsuki Miyu and Ootsubo Yuka for their work for Haiyore! Nyaruko-san.

↧

↧

Seiyuu Video: Akasaki Chinatsu and Kayano Ai (OreShura)

Here's a nice little publicity show for OreShura (Ore no Kanojo to Osananajimi Shuraba Sugiru). It features seiyuus Akasaki Chinatsu (left) and Kayano Ai (right), who play Chiwa and Ai, respectively.

I love the gentle tone, so natural to Kayanon of the Healing Voice. And it's nice to get such a good look at Akasaki-san, who has followed up her outstanding performance as Nibutani Shinka in Chuunibyou demo Koi ga Shitai with good work in this show.

Here's the second half of the show:

Both videos are a bit better seen on the NicoNico site itself. Just click on the video to see it on that site (if you have an account, or watch it here if you don't).

Comments suggest that Kayanon has lost weight. That she is wonderful. And that she is cuuute. She and Akasaki are supposedly friendly off-screen, too. I like it that Akasaki refers to her as "Kayano-kun," suggesting a schoolmate/workmate sort of attitude. Kayanon calls her "Chinatsu-chan."

I believe this is a live broadcast of the weekly OreShura radio show. They are a bit disconcerted to find the makings for shabu-shabu on their work desk, but reconcile to it because there is meat involved.

↧

Yuuki Aoi and Taketatsu Ayana Form New Singing Duo "petit milady"

Amazing news breaks this afternoon that Yuuki Aoi and Taketatsu Ayana are forming a new singing duo called "petit milady," or "puchi mire" for short.

The name means "little milady" in French/English, and is pretty appropriate for the pair: Ao--chan (left) is 4'9" (145cm) all, and Ayachi is 4'11" (151cm).

The announcement was apparently made on a big video screen in Akihabara. A movie announced: "The birth of a new unit with two seiyuus no-one would ever have imagined."

In the video, Ayachi says she was nervous when they told her she was going to form a new singing duo with someone. But when she heard it was Ao-chan, she became completely at ease.

Their first single will be a new Yu-Gi-Oh Zexal II OP, to debut on the April 14 broadcast. No indication that either of them will do voice roles there, but it remains possible.

Ao-chan is just about to turn 21. Ayanyan is 23. Ao-chan is with the Pro-Fit seiyuu agency and her albums have come out on Flying Dog records (Japan Victor). Ayachi is with Pro-Fit's acting agency Assemble Heart, to which she moved from the big I"m Enterprise agency last April. Her music has come out on Pony Canyon. This new single will come out on Universal Music's anime label Zero-A.

Ao-chan is a natural seiyuu with tremendous vocal power and invention (sometimes too much invention). She never went to seiyuu school, having started as a child TV performer and actress. Ayachi went to a big seiyuu school and, while not really a great seiyuu, has a knack for creating popular characters. She started in 2005 as one of the lustful sisters in KissxSis and her top roles are Azunyan in K-On and Kirino in OreImo (of which a new series starts in April).

Why are they getting (being put) together? Perhaps it's just the normal constant movement of the Japanese entertainment industry. Perhaps it's because neither one of them is good enough, or popular enough, on their own to sustain a recording career. I myself think that with the right music and production (e.g., her songs by DEKO*27) Ao-chan is terrific, but others may well not agree.

Anyway, I'm looking forward to this.

EDIT: I found a pic of the big screen, which ad apparently been teasing viewers in Akihabara before the announcement was made:

The words are: "A new unit (i.e., singing group) is born."

↧

Spring 2013 Anime Previews: staff, cast, story, trailer, pic, etc.

This is the season of science fiction. There are seven shows with something sci-fi about them, from a remake of the Space Battleship Yamato series to three mecha shows to a kids' show and a harem romance.

But in this well-populated spring season, we have other genres, too: action fantasy, ecchi comedy, psychological drama, reverse harem....

Here are brief descriptions of 20 shows of interest, followed by full details on all 42 shows:

Aku no Hana– Psychological drama involving a guy who steals a girl’s gym uniform. Another girl sees him do it, and uses that to control him. By the director of Mushishi.

Arata Kangatari – Time travel, body transference, and a bit of skin, from a shounen manga adapted by the director of Shugo Chara and the writer of Pandora Hearts, and starring the voice of Kirito in SAO.

Dansai Bunri no Crime Edge– Mystery romance about a girl whose hair no scissors can cut, and the boy whose scissors cut it.

Date a Live– Science fiction with romance and comedy, starring Inoue Marina and directed by Motonaga Keitarou (Jormungand, Tayutama, School Days).

Devil Survivor 2 The Animation– Action fantasy from an RPG, but with an overwhelming cast: Kamiya Hiroshi, Okamoto Nobuhiko, Suwabe Junichi, Sawashiro Miyuki, Iguchi Yuka, Koshimizu Ami, Asumi Kana, etc., etc.

Ginga Kikoutai Majestic Prince– Motonaga Keitarou and Yoshida Reiko (Marimite, K-On) give us a sci-fi adventure comedy in which genetically altered teens save the human race.

Hentai Ouji to Warawanai Neko– Ecchi romantic comedy starring Ogura Yui, Kaji Yuuki, Ishihara Kaori, Tamura Yukari.

Hyakka Ryouran: Samurai Bride– Another round of the odd supernatural/samurai action breast comedy starring Yuuki Aoi, Kugimiya Rie, Kobayashi Yuu, Kotobuki Minako.

Karneval (2013)– The director of Kodomo no Jikan and the writer of Amnesia try to guide seiyuus such as Kamiya Hiroshi, Satou Satomi, and Ono Daisuke through an adaptation of a josei fantasy manga.

Namiuchigiwa no Muromi-san– Crazy comedy with drunken mermaid Tamura Yukari. Directed by the director of the good recent OVA Aruvu Rezuru, adapted by the writer of Ben-tou.

Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai – A new season of the tremendously popular ecchi comedy with proud blonde imouto Taketatsu Ayana and sarcastic cat girl Hanazawa Kana.

Photo Kano– A dating-sim-based harem romance like KimiKiss and AmagamiSS. A boy with a camera takes photographs of various girls....

RDG: Red Data Girl– PA Works (True Tears, Hanasaku Iroha) animates a best-selling fantasy novel to celebrate Kadokawa Bunko’s 65th anniversary. Stars Hayami Saori in one of her three leading roles this season.

Shingeki no Kyojin– Science fiction horror from the director of Death Note and the writer of the new JoJo. Stars Inoue Marina.

Space Battleship Yamato 2199– This remake of the classic sci-fi series was in theatres last year; BDs have come out for some of it; and a series hits television in April. Episode one looked good to me.

Suisei no Gargantia– Mecha pilot space/time-warps to a backward planet he cannot get off. Written by Urobuchi Gen. With the tiny perfect voices of both Kanemoto Hisako and Kayano Ai.

To Aru Kagaku no Railgun S– Ah, Biri-biri. New season of the school adventure-comedy involving students with superpowers.

Valvrave the Liberator– Mecha science fiction from the director of Kurenai and the writer of Code Geass, starring Seto Asami, Tomatsu Haruka, Kayano Ai, Ousaka Ryouta, Kimura Ryouhei. Ao-chan in the cast.

Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru– School romantic comedy starring Hayami Saori. Yuuki Aoi, Sasaki Nozomi, with Koshimizu Ami also in the cast.

Zettai Bouei Leviathan– Hayami Saori in her third big role of the season, with Kitamura Eri, Taketatsu Ayana, and Hanazawa Kana in a fantasy adventure with lots of elf ears.

Of course, there are plenty of other shows that could be of interest to people. A new season of the extraterrestrial comedy Haiyore! Nyaru-ani. A super-deformed Hokuto no Ken. A comic retelling of Glass Mask with Maya and others as hoodlums. A new season of Hayate. A show in which the characters all personify different bloodtypes. A samurai adventure from the director of Prince of Tennis and Library War. A new season of Uta no Prince-sama. A couple of slice-of-life comedies.

I don't see any masterpieces here, just lots of watchable shows. But time will tell.

Anyway, here comes a complete list, in alphabetical order, linking to complete details (cast, staff, story, pic, preview, manga, forum, etc.):

● Aiura ● Aku no Hana ● Arata Kangatari ● Battle Spirits: Sword Eyes Gekitouden ● Chibi Devi! ● Danchi Tomoo ● Dansai Bunri no Crime Edge ● Date a Live ● DD Hokuto no Ken ● Devil Survivor 2 The Animation ● Dibetagurashi: Ahiru no Seikatsu ● Gakkatsu 2 ● Ginga Kikoutai Majestic Prince ● Glass no Kamen Desu ga ● Haitai Nanafa 2 ● Haiyore! Nyaruko-san W ● Hataraku Maou-sama! ● Hayate no Gotoku! Cuties ● Hentai Ouji to Warawanai Neko ● Hyakka Ryouran: Samurai Bride ● Jewelpet Happiness ● Karneval (2013) ● Ketsuekigata-kun! ● Mushibugyou ● My Little Pony - Friendship is Magic ● Namiuchigiwa no Muromi-san ● Ore no Imouto ga Konna ni Kawaii Wake ga Nai. ● Photo Kano ● Pretty Rhythm: Rainbow Live ● RDG: Red Data Girl ● Shingeki no Kyojin ● Space Battleship Yamato 2199 ● Sparrow`s Hotel ● Suisei no Gargantia ● To Aru Kagaku no Railgun S ● Train Hero ● Uta no Prince-sama: Maji Love 2000% ● Valvrave the Liberator ● Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru ● Yondemasu yo, Azazel-san. Z ● Yuyushiki ● Zettai Bouei Leviathan

Notes:

-- dates and times may change, and will be updated in my anime calendar, which should come out at the beginning of April.

-- information from official sites, MoonPhase, AniDB, Anime News Network, Japanese Wikipedia, et al.

-- English titles link to the Anime News Network encyclopedia; Japanese titles link to official sites. "forum" links to AnimeSuki forum threads.

-- click images to enlarge.

Spring 2013 Shows in Chronological Order:

My Little Pony - Friendship is Magic

(jp: マイリトルポニー ～トモダチは魔法～) jpWiki

young girls' shoujo

director: James Wootton

writer: Rob Renzetti, Jason Thiessen. Lauren Faust (orig).

seiyuus: Mimori Suzuko, Tokui Sora, Sasaki Mikoi, Kitta Izumi, Kumai Motoko, Inoue Kikuko, Katou Emiri, Sawashiro Miyuki.

animation: DHX Media (Vancouver). OP Mimori Suzuko.

trailer. forum.

starts tue 02 apr 07:30

This is made by Vancouver studio DHX Media, and has already been shown in North America. The only reason I am including it here is the Japanese cast, which includes a number of well-known young seiyuus (Mimori Suzuko, Tokui Sora, Kitta Izumi) and some who are even more familiar (Sawashiro Miyuki, Katou Emiri, Inoue Kikuko).

I do look forward to seeing at least an episode or so of a show like this. Unicorn pony Twilight Sparkle is studious and quiet. Princess Celestia tells her she must not just sit and read, but learn to make friends. So she and the baby dragon Spike travel to the countryside, where they have adventures and find friends.

Check out early posts at the "forum" link for a discussion and links about the popularity of this kids' show among older teens and adults.

Train Hero

(jp: トレインヒーロー) jpWiki

young shounen sci-fi adventure with transforming trains

seiyuus: Namikawa Daisuke, Ono Daisuke, Okitsu Kazuyuki.

animation: Carloon.

26eps.

starts tue 02 apr 17:30

In the year 2100, under increasing environmental pressure, humans develop a system of fast trains running on "razor rails" around the world. Some of the people charged with managing the system develop the ability to transform into trains themselves. A Japan-China co-production.

DD Hokuto no Ken

(jp: DD北斗の拳) jpWiki

comedy

director: Daichi Akitarou (Fruits Basket, Bokura ga Ita, Gag Manga Biyori)

seiyuus: Tachibana Shinnosuke, Seki Tomokazu, Horie Yui, Okiayu Ryoutarou, Ichijou Kazuya, Ichimichi Mao, Kamiya Akira, Morishima Shuuta, Shocker Ono.

animation: Ajia-dou.

trailer. manga.

starts tue 02 apr 25:40

A special project commemorating the 30th anniversary of the Hokuto no Ken manga. Super-deformed versions of the characters from the original series are now living in peaceful contemporary Japan: working in a convenience store; in a factory; looking for work; or laid low by illness. The legend of the Fighting NEET North Star begins.

Gakkatsu 2

(jp: ガッ活！第2シリーズ) jpWiki

debate comedy

director: Rareko (Tender Tank)

writer: Rareko, Fukihara Kouta (TV drama Otomen).

seiyuus: Kawashi Miyuki, Azakami Youhei, Arai Souta.

animation: Fanworks, NHK.

trailer.

starts wed 03 apr 19:55

5 minute episodes. Middle school class rep Chiho keeps stirring up absurd debates, but the atmosphere she creates enlivens the whole class. She and her classmates duel with words, some of which strike home.

Dansai Bunri no Crime Edge

(jp: 断裁分離のクライムエッジ) jpWiki

mystery romance

director: Yamaguchi Yuuji (Strawberry Eggs, Fate Stay/Night, Touka Gettan)

writer: Urahata Tatsuhiko (Monster, Saki, OreShura). Hikagi Tatsuhiko (manga).

seiyuus: Hanae Natsuki (TariTari/Wien), Koiwai Kotori (Joshiraku/Kigurumi), Uchiyama Yumi (Sukitte ii/Aiko), Fukuhara Kaori, Yasunoi Kiyono, Shimazaki Nobunaga, Yusa Kouji, Noto Arisa.

animation: Studio Gokumi. OP Aimi, ED Takahashi Karin x Endou Yurika.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts wed 03 apr 24:30

Kiri seems like an ordinary high-school boy. But he is obsessed with cutting people's hair. Iwai, the "Hair Queen," has a curse on her that prevents anything from ever cutting her hair. It has been growing unchecked since she was born. But Kiri discovers that his scissors can actually cut her hair. Unfortunately, their meeting brings to life an old game aiming to murder the Hair Queen. Kiri becomes her protector.

Koiwai Kotori is a young seiyuu whose only other major role was as Kigurumi in Joshiraku. She also played Yuki in Psycho-Pass. Hanae Natsuki played Wien in TariTari. Director Yamaguchi Yuuji did the Unlimited Blade Works movie, but before that, his last show was Touka Gettan in 2007. Writer Urahata Tatsuhiko, however, is doing OreShura, and has many credits to his name, including Monster and Saki.

RDG: Red Data Girl

(jp: RDG レッドデータガール) jpWiki

supernatural fantasy drama (with romance?)

director: Shinohara Toshiya

writer: Yokote Michiko. Ogiwara Noriko (novel).

seiyuus: Hayami Saori, Uchiyama Kouki, Fukuyama Jun, Kimura Ryouhei, Kugimiya Rie, Yonezawa Madoka, Ishikawa Kaito, Emi Sarah Bridcut, Ishida Akira, Inoue Kazuhiko, Paku Romi, Nojima Hirofumi.

animation: PA Works. OP Annabel, ED Itou Masumi.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts wed 03 apr 25:00

Kadokawa Bunko celebrates its 65th anniversary with this new show from PA Works starring Hayami Saori, Uchiyama Kouki, and Fukuyama Jun, among others.

Shy 15 year old Izumiko was born and raised at the ancient Tamakura Shrine. For some reason, her mere touch causes computers and phones to freeze up. Her parents -- who are working elsewhere -- want her to go to Tokyo for high school, but she wants to stay in the country, where she finally has a couple of friends. The opinion isn’t universal, but I loved the preview streaming of episode one, both the story and, especially, Hayami Saori's hesitant voicing of Izumiko.

Veteran director Shinohara Toshiya did various Inuyasha movies, as well as Gunparade Orchestra and Book of Bantorra. Veteran writer Yokote Michiko was lead writer on such shows as Princess Tutu, Genshiken, XXXholic, Squid Girl, and Joshiraku. Great cast, great staff. Promising show from PA Works (True Tears, Hanasaku Iroha, TariTari).

Uta no Prince-sama: Maji Love 2000%

(jp: うたの☆プリンスさまっ♪マジLOVE2000%) jpWiki

reverse harem with music

director: Kou Yuu

writer: Kou Yuu. Kunozuki Kanon, Broccoli.

seiyuus: Toriumi Kousuke, Suzumura Kenichi, Miyano Mamoru, Terashima Takuma, Suwabe Junichi, Shimono Hiro, Sawashiro Miyuki, Taniyama Kishou, Maeno Tomoaki, Yusa Kouji.

animation: A-1 Pictures. OP Miyano Mamoru, ED ST☆RISH.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts wed 03 apr 26:05

In the first series, our heroine was in the composition course at an arts high school, and there were six bishounen singers for her to choose to partner with. Now they are all in the master course with students who are at an even higher level.

Great cast features Toriumi Kousuke, Suzumura Kenichi, Miyano Mamoru, Suwabe Junichi, Taniyama Kishou…and Sawashiro Miyuki. Director/writer Kou Yuu directed Loveless and Giant Killing. The "trailer" link is to a song by Miyano Mamoru from the first series.

Karneval (2013)

(jp: カーニヴァル (2013)) jpWiki

josei fantasy adventure

director: Suganuma Eiji (Kodomo no Jikan, Alison to Lilia, Mashiro-iro Symphony)

writer: Machida Touko (Lucky Star, GA, Amnesia). Mikanagi Touya (manga).

seiyuus: Kamiya Hiroshi, Shimono Hiro, Hirakawa Daisuke, Satou Satomi, Ono Daisuke, Igarashi Hiromi, Honna Youko, Nakamura Yuuichi, Hoshi Souichirou, Kitamura Eri.

animation: Manglobe. OP Granrodeo, ED KAmiYU.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts wed 03 apr 26:48

The first thing that strikes you is the cast list: from Kamiya Hiroshi (taking a break from the Bake-Nise-Neko-Kizu-Monogatari series) to Satou Satomi returning to the screen powered up by her excellent performance in Hyouka.

Two lost souls: with only an abandoned bracelet as a clue, Nai searches for someone important to him; Gareki steals and picks pockets to get by. The two meet in a strange mansion where they are tricked into becoming wanted criminals. At a moment of desperate danger, they encounter none other than the country's most powerful defense organization, "Circus," which may become their way out.

Director Suganuma Eiji and writer Machida Touko, along with the strong cast, give this show possibilities. OP by Granrodeo (Taniyama Kishou), ED by KAmiYU (Kamiya Hiroshi and Irino Miyu). Another preview.

Hataraku Maou-sama!

(jp: はたらく魔王さま!) jpWiki

fantasy comedy

director: Hosoda Naoto (Shuffle, Mirai Nikki)

writer: Yokotani Masahiro (Keroro Gunsou, Reideen, Busou Shinki). Wagahara Satoshi (novel).

seiyuus: Ono Yuuki, Ousaka Ryoutarou, Touyama Nao, Hikasa Youko, Itou Kanae, Shimono Hiro.

animation: White Fox.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts thu 04 apr 22:00

Mao the Demon King is defeated in his quest to conquer a world. He and his general end up in an even more alien world: contemporary Tokyo, where Mao has to work at a fast-food restaurant to make ends meet. Meanwhile, the female hero Emilia, who defeated him in that other world, shows up and confronts him.

Director Hosoda Naoto did Shuffle and Mirai Nikki. Writer Yokotani Masahiro has been lead writer for Keroro Gunsou, Reideen, and Busou Shinki (how's that for range, lol?) Interesting cast features Ono Yuuki (Zenkichi in Medaka Box) and Ousaka Ryoutarou (Eita in OreShura), with Touyama Nao, Hikasa Youko, and Itou Kanae.

Ginga Kikoutai Majestic Prince

(jp: 銀河機攻隊 マジェスティックプリンス) jpWiki

mecha science fiction adventure/comedy

director: Motonaga Keitarou (School Days, Jormungand)

writer: Yoshida Reiko (Marimite, D.Gray-man, K-On, Girls und Panzer). Ayamine Rando (manga).

seiyuus: Asanuma Shintarou, Aiba Hiroki (Prince of Tennis, TV dramas), Iguchi Yuka, Hikasa Youko, Ikeda Junya, Asano Masumi, Suzuki Chihiro, Midorikawa Hikaru, Touchi Hiroki, Sawashiro Miyuki, Itou Shizuka, Toriumi Kousuke, Nojima Hirofumi.

animation: Douga Koubou, Orange. OP Kon Natsumi, ED Ishihara Chiaki.

trailer. forum.

starts thu 04 apr 22:30

Having succeeded in expanding into space, mankind has located multiple asteroids filled with resources which should allow for a safe and prosperous future. However, a powerful galactic empire begins to invade, pushing mankind to the brink of destruction. A secret genetic manipulation project may be the last hope for humanity. A group of genetically improved children known as "Team Rabbits" can use special weaponry. The team is sent to the front line. Can they survive against such an overwhelming enemy?

Motonaga Keitarou and Yoshida Reiko make a powerful director/writer team, if they are at their best (Motonaga's Jormungand, Yoshida's Nodame Cantabile) rather than their worst (AkaSaka, Romeo + Juliet). The mecha designs (Moriki Yasuhiro, Tani Hiroshi, Watanabe Koji) are drawing plenty of praise. The character designs by Hirai Hisashi (Gundam Seed, Linebarrels) turn some people off, but there is plenty here to attract interest. Quality cast includes actor Aiba Hiroki, as well as Hikasa Youko, Asano Masumi, and Sawashiro Miyuki.

Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru

(jp: やはり俺の青春ラブコメはまちがっている.) jpWiki

comedy, romance

director: Yoshimura Ai

writer: Suga Shoutarou. Wataru Watari (novel).

seiyuus: Eguchi Takuya, Hayami Saori, Sasaki Nozomi, Kondou Takashi, Yuuki Aoi, Yuzuki Ryouka, Koshimizu Ami, Inoue Marina, Komatsu Mikako, Touyama Nao.

animation: Brain's Base. OP Yanagi Nagi, ED Hayami Saori, Touyama Nao.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts thu 04 apr 25:28

Antisocial high school student Hachiman has no friends and a sour view of life. His dream for the future is to live without having to work. He thinks his classmates are faking their apparent enthusiasm. A teacher gets Hachiman to join the volunteer service club, one member of which happens to be the school's prettiest girl….

The big attraction for me here is Hayami Saori in a leading role, and singing the ED. But the show also includes two more of my favorite seiyuus: Yuuki Aoi and Sasaki Nozomi (Nana-chan in Bokura ga Ita, Sapphy in Jewelpet). Not to mention Yuzuki Ryouka, Koshimizu Ami, Inoue Marina, Komatsu Mikako, and Touyama Nao.

Yoshimura Ai has done storyboards and/or episode direction on Sora no Manima ni and Daily Lives of High School Boys, but this is her first job as director of a whole series. Writer Suga Shoutarou was lead writer for the second half of the first season of Darker than Black, and on all varieties of Rinne no Lagrange.

Photo Kano

(jp: フォトカノ) jpWiki

seinen harem romance

director: Yokoyama Akitoshi

writer: Yokoyama Akitoshi.

seiyuus: Shimazaki Nobunaga, Itou Kanae, Nakahara Mai, Kanemoto Hisako, Mizuhara Kaoru, Saitou Chiwa, Oogame Asuka, Sawashiro Miyuki, Ise Mariya, Endou Aya, Hasegawa Akiko, Takagaki Ayahi, Midorikawa Hikaru, Okamoto Nobuhiko.

animation: Madhouse. OP hayatokaori, ED seiyuus.

trailer. manga. 12eps. forum.

starts thu 04 apr 25:58

Like KimiKiss and AmagamiSS, this is based on a dating sim game from Enterbrain. On the last day of summer vacation, main character Kazuya gets a camera from his father. Fall semester begins and Kazuya starts taking photos of girls…photo sessions that slide toward romance. We don't know yet whether the show will be an anthology of girl friends, like Amagami, or will end up following one particular girl's route. Most likely, we will have a number of small relationships culminating in one larger relationship.

Director/writer Yokoyama Akitoshi is doing his first TV series. His only previous directoral job was the Marimo no Hana OVA, but he has done lots of storyboards and episode direction: Samurai Champloo, Gurren Lagann, Kaiba, Tatami Galaxy, Deadman Wonderland. How he will adapt to romance remains to be seen, lol. Madhouse. Great cast. Photography. I'll be there to see episode one.

Devil Survivor 2 The Animation

(jp: Devil Survivor 2 The Animation) jpWiki

action fantasy

director: Kishi Seiji (Seto no Hanayome, Angel Beats, Persona 4)

writer: Uezu Makoto (Seto no Hanayome, Seikon no Qwaser, Jinrui wa Suitai Shimashita). Atlus.

seiyuus: Kamiya Hiroshi, Okamoto Nobuhiko, Uchida Aya, Suwabe Junichi, Sawashiro Miyuki, Yamaguchi Rikako, Iguchi Yuka, Saitou Fuko, Koshimizu Ami, Asumi Kana, Namikawa Daisuke, Madono Mitsuaki, Koyama Rikiya, Sakurai Takahiro, Inoue Kikuko.

animation: Bridge.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts thu 04 apr 26:05

From an RPG for Nintendo DS. Thirteen "devil survivors" make deals with devils to obtain abilities to fight against unknown invaders. With only 7 days left until a world catastrophe, they need to make crucial decisions….

Director Kishi Seiji and writer Uezu Makoto did Seto no Hanayome together, and now they get back together to make a very diifferent show. The cast is fairly overwhelming: Kamiya Hiroshi, Okamoto Nobuhiko, Uchida Aya, Suwabe Junichi, Sawashiro Miyuki, Iguchi Yuka, Koshimizu Ami, Asumi Kana, etc., etc. Definitely worth a look.

Aku no Hana

(jp: 惡の華) jpWiki

shounen psychological drama

director: Nagahama Hiroshi (Mushishi)

writer: Itami Aki. Oshimi Shuuzou (manga).

seiyuus: Ueda Shinichirou, Ise Mariya, Hikasa Youko, Uemura Ayako, Hamazoe Shinya, Hara Sayuri, Matsuzaki Katsutoshi.

animation: Zexcs. OP Uchuujin.

trailer. manga. forum.

starts fri 05 apr 22:00

Kasuga is a bookish boy who loves the poems of 19th-century French poet Charles Baudelaire ("Flowers of Evil"). One day after school, he steals the gym clothes of the girl he has a crush on. However, another girl in his class sees him and blackmails him into a contract, threatening to reveal his secret and spoil his chances with the girl forever.

I'm not a big fan of the manga, partly because none of the characters are likable. But if you enjoy dabbling in the dark recesses of the soul, there are some dark recesses here to dabble in. And the animation is something different: rotoscoping. This means that they trace over images of live actors to make the animation. Check out the trailer for some interesting images.

Director Nagahama Hiroshi did Mushishi, and writer Itami Aki wrote a number of episodes of that show. I found that show boring, myself, but it was quality work. Not the most famous cast, but the presence of Ise Mariya and Hikasa Youko sounds good.

Several hundred years ago, humans were nearly exterminated by giants. Giants were humanoids several stories tall, seemed to have no intelligence, and devoured human beings. A small percentage of humanity survived by walling themselves in a city protected by extremely high walls, even taller than the biggest of giants. The city has now not seen a giant in over 100 years. This remake of Leiji Matsumoto's 1974 classic was shown in theatres in Japan last year and now comes to TV in what is by most accounts a good remake. In 2199, a war with a techologically superior alien race has rendered the Earth uninhabitable. Survivors live underground. Our heroes learn of a friendly alien race which is willing to give humans the technology to defeat their enemies -- if only they can come to their very distant world and get it. They provide plans for a faster-than-light ship and the Yamato is built. We follow its crew on their difficult journey to get technology that can save the human race.

Directed and written by multitalented designer/writer Izubuchi Yutaka, who created and directed RahXephon. Excellent cast starts with Sugo Takayuki, who began his career as Fang Tchewling in LoGH, and has been Wanyuudou in Hell Girl, Albert de Blois in Gosick, and Cardeas Vist in Gundam UC. BD releases are already well underway, but it is only now reaching Japanese TV. I've seen episode one and enjoyed it.

I like the set-up, but the director comes with little directoral experience and not much anime work in the past several years. And no lead writer is named. Tamaki is played by Nagashima Haruka, who made an impression as Kaori in Shiki.

High-school sophomore Youto is always thinking about sex, but is such a model student that no one notices. He learns about a statue of an "unsmiling cat" that supposedly grants wishes, and goes to pray that he will be able to express his lustful thoughts in ways that people will actually hear. At the statue, Youto encounters Tsukiko, a girl from his high school with her own wish: that she become less childish and not display her feelings so openly.

This is Ogura Yui's biggest role yet, and I think she has finally got the chops to succeed in it. Her voice work is now rising to match the level of her extreme cuteness. Her singing partner in YuiKaori, Ishihara Kaori, is also in the show. Kaori is already one of the top young seiyuus, and won a "new seiyuu" award a couple of weeks ago. And Tamura Yukari is here, too.

Director Suzuki Youhei is doing his first show. He has done storyboards and episodes of Mahoraba, Zero no Tsukaima, Kimikiss, Ookami-san, etc. Lead writer Itou Michiko has done Ookami-san and Ro-kyu-bu, as well as multiple episodes of shows such as Suzuka, KimiKiss, Tegami Bachi, and Sakurasou. I'm feeling positive about this show. Original character design by Kantoku, who did the illustrations for the novel.

Tamura Yukari -- Idol and Seiyuu

I decided to make Tamura Yukari 田村ゆかり my seiyuu for spring mainly because she's a highly popular seiyuu whom I haven't featured yet and who has three good roles in the coming anime season. I've always liked her voice work, in a lukewarm sort of way, but I've never taken her that seriously.

But now that I've seen more of her, in researching this post, I can understand the passionate support her fans give her. She's a charming person and a real entertainer.

Yukarin is one of 2channel's absolute favorites. On the Japanese discussion board, her thread is enormous: over 800,000 posts. Among seiyuus, this is second only to Mizuki Nana (who has just over a million posts), and well ahead of Horie Yui and Hirano Aya, who each have around 500,000. I hasten to add that Aya's thread is now full of negative posts, unlike Yukarin's, which is basically a love-fest.

Yukarin's most famous role is as Nanoha in Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha. Other well-known roles include Ichigo in Please Teacher, Kawasumi Mai in Kanon (both versions), Akazukin in Otogijushi Akazukin, Tenten in Naruto, Togame in Katanagatari, Yamada in B-gata H-kei, Kanako and Meruru in OreImo, Rika in Higurashi, and Masuzu in the recently completed OreShura. This season, she will be the mermaid Muromi-san in Namiuchigawa no Muromi-san, and Wakatsuki-sensei in Aiura, as well as reprising her role(s) in OreImo.

Her list of works on Japanese Wikipedia is huge: anime, music, games, concerts, TV appearances, radio, and even planetarium narration. If any seiyuu is making a good living, it must be Yukarin.

Yukari-hime was born 27 February 1976 and grew up in Fukuoka, on the southern Japanese island of Kyushu. In elementary school, she admired Fukuoka-born idol Matsuda Seiko and the idol/magical girl anime Magical Angel Creamy Mami, and decided she wanted to become an idol. At the same time, her friends made fun of her high voice, so she started to learn how to make her voice sound lower.

In middle school, she joined both the choir and the drama club. In high school, she was in the drama club and the manga research club. She went to a commerce-oriented high school, where she gained qualifications in abacus, book-keeping, insurance, and other subjects.

After graduation, she went to work in a company, but at the same time took courses at the Yoyogi Animation branch school in Fukuoka. She got a position as an assistant on a local late-night radio show, but no real seiyuu roles. So she quit her job, packed up, moved to Tokyo and became a student at the big Nihon Narration seiyuu school.

She got her first role at about 19, as a waitress in a PC game on which one of her teachers was the sound director. She got very few seiyuu roles at first, and did more singing. She had little money and lived a hard life.

In 1996, she became a regular on a radio top hits show. In 1999, the show put Yukarin and Horie Yui together as a singing unit called Yamato Nadeshiko. This helped make both of them popular idols. Later, some fans said they were actually a couple. This seems to have been based mainly on Hocchan saying later that they had once walked around their hotel room naked.

Yukarin's singing career was making progress. She put out her first single in 1997. In 1999, she issued four singles. None of these sold enough to enter the charts, however.

But starting in 2002, she crept up above 100th place, and slowly made her way up to the top ten, which she reached in 2005, with Spiritual Garden. Since then, almost all her songs have been in the top ten, as high as #4. She has had a total of 27 singles, of which ten have reached the top ten.

Her anime work was continuing to grow. From 1998 on, she had several roles a year, in addition to an even larger number of voice roles in games.

Most of you may have an idea of her seiyuu work. But her true popularity comes from her work as an idol, and the relationship she creates with her fans. Here are a couple of videos that opened my eyes. First, from 2001, a live event in support of the release of her first album:

Next, I believe from last year (ten years later!), a clip from a concert on a grander scale, showing just how well she and her fans work together:

She has the knack of seeming relaxed and intimate even in the midst of a grand performance. She presents herself as ditzy and vague, but is somehow able to twist huge crowds around her little finger. There is more to her than she lets on.

And here is a clip entitled "Tamura Yukari destroys the human race." She tells the audience that her magic wand will make them all fall madly in love with her. After she uses it once, they all chant "again, again" and she obliges, with devastating results:

One of the things that makes her such a favorite is how closely she corresponds to the otaku notion of an ideal female: cute, sexy, and obliging. As I say, I think there is more to her than this public image, but she wears the image seamlessly.

To get an idea of what she is like in a calmer setting, here are three videos: an interview about an early role (2001), some clips from what appears to be an internet TV show, and finally a "making of" video for the PV for her 2008 single Bambino, Bambina:

There's something that I have never heard anyone mention, but that has always struck me: she's actually pretty funny-looking. Huge ears, low forehead, strong features, very broad cheeks. But I've learned from seeing these and other videos that all that is beside the point: she moves gracefully and conveys charm and femininity with her every move. Now that we know that, here are more photos:

Finally, we reach her actual seiyuu roles. Here are pics of a few of her characters (mouseover for names):

And here are a couple of videos giving us a taste of her seiyuu voice. First, a compendium of voices she has used playing Nanoha:

Next, a scene from Kanon:

Finally, two more videos: first, "An Angel's Day Off," showing Yukarin wandering around Paris:

And here is the music video for her most recent single:

Rather than trying to type out a complete list of her work, I'm going to link you to Wikipedia, which has a good, if incomplete, list of her anime, game, and musical work. For a complete list, I'm afraid I have to send you to Japanese Wikipedia. There are just too many roles and CDs and events for a blog post. Anime News Network has a fairly complete list of her anime work.

For more pics of Yukarin, check here or here. For more videos, search YouTube on her name in Japanese: 田村ゆかり

Character/seiyuu pages: Red Data Girl, Crime Edge, Gargantia, Yuyushiki

I've done character/seiyuu pages for four spring shows so far: RDG: Red Data Girl, Dansai Bunri no Crime Edge, Suisei no Gargantia, and Yuyushiki.

The pages show images of characters and their seiyuus, with some info about each seiyuu.

So far, Suisei no Gargantia is my favorite show of the season. Red Data Girl is a close second. Kanemoto Hisako in Gargantia and Hayami Saori in RDG are both giving fascinating performances.

I'm also enjoying Shingeki no Kyojin ("Attacking Giants"), which is almost too heavy for me. As anime, it may be the bet show of the season. Aku no Hana is another excellent show, but it is so dark that I can't actually bear to watch it.

Crime Edge is weird but enjoyable, and former gravure idol Koiwai Kotori has a voice that suits the character. Yuyushiki is another little comedy show featuring cute girls doing cute things, but the off-kilter humour pleases me.

I'm also enjoying Yahari Ore no Seishun Love Come wa Machigatteiru, in part for another excellent performance from Hayami Saori. She may be putting herself in line for a seiyuu award this year.

I'm a huge fan of Yuuki Aoi, but even I can't sit through the stupidity of Hyakka Ryouran Samurai Bride just to hear her voice.

Seiyuu Video: Yuuki Aoi in Valvrave -- the most Amazing "Arigatou" Ever?

I haven't been watching Kakumeiki Valvrave. Sunrise mecha shows are not usually my thing. But on NicoNico someone has posted a four-second clip from episode 8 of Yuuki Aoi's character Renboukouji Akira saying arigatou ("thank you"):

I find this amazingly effective. Others may find it ridiculous. But in any case I can't imagine anyone other than Ao-chan having the daring invention and vocal skill to say the line this way.

In the scene, she has been tied up and kept out of commission for a while, and the girl she is speaking with has just come and untied her. The hesitancy arises from her character's shyness: she hardly ever speaks to anyone other than her brother. The girl she is speaking with (Sashinami Shouko) is played by another emerging star, Seto Asami. The clip comes at about the 8:00 mark of episode 8.

The comments are: "Read: 'Ar...ga...tou,'" "Cute!" and "Kewt!" Click the three dots at the lower right to hide the comments. The clip takes a few seconds to appear after you click the arrow.

2013 Summer Anime Full Previews

Monogatari Series: Second Season

Perhaps the anime industry has recovered from some of its doldrums. Summer is usually a down season, but there are 37 new series starting this summer, and almost all of them hold some promise. I'll quickly mention some shows first, then go on to detailed info about all the shows.

I've been able to whittle down the list to six that I am most looking forward to…but there are another 12 that deserve special attention, too. First my six most anticipated shows:

Monogatari Series: Second Season– I’m one of the people who thinks of Shinbou as a genius and Bakemonogatari as a masterpiece, so I’m more than eager to see this continuation of the story.

Kingdom 2– Underrated partly because of its unique style, this rip-roaring tale of the time of the First Emperor of China grabbed me from the start and has not let go.

Uchouten Kazoku– PA Works animates an award-winning novel (not a "light" novel) by the author of Tatami Galaxy, set in a magical version of Kyouto.

Watashi ga Motenai no wa Dou Kangaete mo Omaera ga Warui! – A dark comedy from Oonuma Shin featuring a teen girl who spends all her time dating guys in games and is surprised to discover that in real life, she has become a creepy hikikomori.

Rozen Maiden (2013)– A revival of the mid-2000s franchise, with the same great cast, but now written by Mochizuki Tomomi (YKK, Touka Gettan, Zettai Shounen). I can’t wait to see what he does with it.

Genshiken Nidaime– Our familiar club members are graduating, and a new crop of young members arrives, including one played by real-life otaku Uesaka Sumire.

Free

And now for 12 more shows of interest:

Brothers Conflict – When her father remarries, a girl goes to live in a mansion with her eleven new brothers. Classic reverse harem with a good male cast.

Danganronpa The Animation– The staff that made Humanity Has Declined puts fifteen bright teens in a school where they can only graduate by killing or being killed.

Fantasista Doll– The director of Bamboo Blade and Haganai, and the writer of Ebiten, give us a story involving cute magical fighting dolls, with a cast of young stars including Uesaka Sumire (Dekomori in Chuunibyou), Akasaki Chinatsu (Nibutani), and Misawa Sachika (Kuroyukihime in Accel World).

Fate/Kaleid Liner Prisma Illya – Oonuma Shin directs a strange Fate/Stay Night spinoff in which Illya is a magical girl attending high school.

Free!– Kyoto Animation has elicited plenty of griping from its core fans by presenting this story centred on a boys' high school swim team. Fujoshi buying power, lol.

Gatchaman Crowds– Uchida Maaya (Rikka in Chuunibyou) stars in a remake of the old fighting series, remade by the staff that did Tsuritama.

Gifuu Doudou!! Kanetsugu to Keiji – Male friendship among warriors in the Sengoku Period. Based on a manga by the author of Fist of the North Star. Directed by the director of Hetalia and Hiiro no Kakera. Moar fujoshi powah!

Gin no Saji (Silver Spoon)– The director of Sword Art Online adapts the story of a studious city boy who gets more than he bargained for when he goes to a school in the countryside.

Inu to Hasami wa Tsukaiyou– Sakurai Takahiro, Inoue Marina, Itou Shizuka, Uchida Maaya, Saitou Chiwa…in the story of a boy who dies and is resurrected as a dachshund.

Kami-sama no Inai Nichiyoubi– Strong novel and manga about a world of death, and an unlikely partnership. Starring Toyosaki Aki and Namikawa Daisuke, and written by Konparu Tomoko (Nadja, NANA, Nodame Cantabile).

Kimi no Iru Machi – From a popular shounen romance manga by the author of Suzuka. Adapted by the writer of Marimite and K-On, directed by the director of Casshern Sins.

Kitakubu Katsudou Kiroku– Talented mid-teen seiyuu Kido Ibuki gets another starring role, in a moe slice-of-life anime.

Love Lab– Seiyuu Akasaki Chinatsu (Nibutani in Chuunibyou) stars in a seinen/josei comedy about girls practicing for love, made by the staff than made Mitsudomoe and YuruYuri.

Makai Ouji: Devils and Realist – Kon Chiaki and Yokote Michiko bring us a story about demons and a beautiful young man.

Rou Kyuu Bu! SS -- Pure moe gets a second season. Or maybe it's not actually so pure…. Hanazawa Kana, Ogura Yui, Hikasa Youko, et al.

Senki Zesshou Symphogear G– A new season of the musical magical girl anime starring Yuuki Aoi, Mizuki Nana, and Takagaki Ayahi.

Servant x Service– From a comic manga about life in a government department, by the author of Working. With Kayano Ai, Nakahara Mai, Toyosaki Aki, Sakurai Takahiro, Ookubo Rumi, Takahashi Mikako….

Stella Women's Academy, High School Division Class C3– Girls and guns. About a girls’ high school with a program teaching military theory and practice. Fans of Girls und Panzer, take note.

Tamayura: More Aggressive – A new season of Satou Takuya’s healing anime. Not very aggressive, really.

Read on for more details about all the shows: story, staff, cast, trailer, manga, image, forums, etc.

Kazuhito lives on his own in Tokyo, going to hgh school. But he is obsessed with books, and reads several a day. One day, he is killed during a robbery in the café where he is reading.

Somehow, he is resurrected as a dachshund, and can no longer read. He goes on to live with the sadistic girl Kirihime, who uses scissors as a weapon. Scissors again! As in Dansai Bunri. The story is weird enough to be interesting.

The names in the cast are very interesting: Sakurai Takahiro, Inoue Marina, Itou Shizuka, Uchida Maaya, Saitou Chiwa, et al. But the staff brings only question marks. First-time director Takahashi Yukio directed epsiodes of Shangri-la and Last Exile Fam. Animation by Gonzo.

Another season of five-minute episodes of this comic fantasy directed by Yamamoto Yutaka -- who has appaently not quit anime, as he threatened to a couple of years ago.

Long ago, there lived an evil being called Satan Rukimedes, who reigned over the world through fear. He invaded the human world with his many demons, spreading madness and chaos. A thousand years ago, he was sealed away by the hero Creation, and peace returned to the world. Now a hole has opened up and the demons are coming back. It's up to the descendants of the hero to kill the demon king.

Great cast. Top writer Yokote Michiko is back. And Yamakan does have something….

Fifteen elite high school students gather at a very special high school where graduation guarantees success in life. The school is presided over by a bear called Monokuma. He explains to them that the only way to graduate is to kill one of your classmates and get away with it. If the other classmates discover the identity of the killer, the killer is executed. But if they fail to catch the killer, only the killer graduates and all the others are killed. Which of the 15 will survive the bloodbath to come? The game has many dedicated fans, who say that the story involves good mysteries that make sense are are difficult but not impossible to solve.

Director Kishi Seiji and writer Uezu Makoto worked together on Humanity Has declined. Two veteran seiyuus head the cast: Ogata Megumi (Shinji in NGE, Yugi in Yu-Gi-Oh), and Oomoto Makiko (Corrector Yui). They are supported by a bevy of stars: Sakurai Takahiro, Hikasa Youko, Ishida Akira, Yamaguchi Kappei, Saitou Chiwa, Sawashiro Miyuki, Shiina Hekiru, Nakai Kazuya, et al.

This could be one of the most popular shows of the season. Uezu Makoto has another bloody tale with which to try to repeat his iconic success with School Days. The first episode was pre-aired at a special event on 23 June.

A new director and writer handle substantially the same cast in a third series of the classic anime from 2004-05. New director is Hatakeyama Mamoru, who directed Sankarea. New writer is Mochizuki Tomomi, the genius who wrote and directed Yokohama Kaidashi Kikou, directed Zettai Shounen and House of Five Leaves, and wrote Touka Gettan. The two take over from Matsuo Kou and Hanada Jukki, respectively.

Most of the same cast returns, with the addition of Ousaka Ryouta as an older Jun. In a new world where he has never met Shinku, Jun becomes a university student. Mysteriously, he now gets a new opportunity to meet her. More mysteriously, the new world and the world of the first series are intertwined. I didn't love the first two series, but Mochizuki Tomomi and the new story draw me in.

God abandoned the world on a Sunday, fifteen years ago. Now nobody ever dies, and no babies are ever born. Death is managed by "gravekeepers." Little Ai (Toyosaki Aki) is the gravekeeper for a village. She has prepared 47 graves, one for each member of the village.

One day, a young man (Namikawa Daisuke) arrives in the village calling himself "Hampnie Hambart, the Man-eating Toy" -- which is the name that Ai's mother left behind as the name of her vanished father. The newcomer proceeds to slaughter everyone except Ai. And then he and Ai bury them together….
